title: Travel with Scenic | The Jewels of Europe River Cruise

json.text: The Rhine Main and Danube
once passed through principalities ruled by mighty dynasties that shaped
incredible civilisations
today these jewels of Europe still stand
so many of the villagers along these great rivers have lived a charmed life
and remain as beautiful and engaging as ever
along these old trade routes you'll encounter all the very best that Europe has to offer
so step aboard a Scenic spaceship and you'll only need to unpack once as we
deliver you straight to the heart of the jewels of Europe your journey into
wonder begins in the Hungarian capital of Budapest a city rich in history
dating back to the first century BC discover why Budapest is known as the
city of spas and unwind as the ancient Romans once did at the invigorating
thermal spas you’ll bid szia to Budapest and reacquaint yourself with the
five-star Scenic spaceship as we cruise the mighty Danube towards the
resplendent city of Vienna savour the inspiring scenery from the comfort of
our lavish lounges and viewing areas you may want to ask your butler to prepare
some evening wear
for a glorious evening at Vienna's Palais Liechtenstein a glass of fine
Austrian sector waits for you to enjoy before being completely enchanted by a
private concert featuring ballet and the enduring music of Strauss and Mozart
on your second day in Vienna as the music still lingers serenely in your mind
enjoy a range of free choice options at your leisure a visit to Vienna’s
world-renowned riding school
alternatively for budding historians a guided tour of Bratislava or Schönbrunn Palace awaits
for a change of pace as we leave Vienna behind choose a guided
cycle along the Danube river on a courtesy e-bikes from Dürnstein to
Melk through stunning Wachau Valley
once we arrived in Melk the chance to explore the magnificent Melk Abbey awaits
founded in 1089 this is one of the most spectacular monasterial buildings in the world
and as the day draws to a close toast the day's discovery with Scenic sundowners
the next day we traveled to picturesque Salzburg to enrich the day's experience
the best of the ‘Sound of Music’ and Salzburg show will transport you to
another time and place based on the timeless movie of the same name
this exclusive production performed in the rolling hills of Salzburg will
astonish you with its meticular sets and iconic music from the film
sailing on to Nuremberg a city steeped in history
where free choice options include visits to the heart rendering world war two sites
or for something lighter the taste of Nuremberg is pure Bavarian indulgence for the taste buds
there's just something about cobbled streets that brings a place to life with
history in Bamberg you'll have the chance to walk them as medieval traders
once did accompanied by an experienced local guide
then we proceed to Würzburg where free choice comes in the shape of
a visit to the Bishop's residence palace
before moving onto Freudenberg for a chance to celebrate Scenic’s version of
the world's largest beer festival Oktoberfest
as morning breaks we arrived in Rüdesheim a place that evokes
thoughts of fairy tales and folklore for a guided visit of Siegfried's Mechanical Museum
and as the Scenic spaceship moves from Rüdesheim to Marksburg we advise taking
to the viewing areas as this portion of the voyage through the world heritage-listed
Rhine Gorge is perhaps the most spectacular on any European waterway
our final Scenic enrich experience will submerse you in
medieval ambience at Marksburg Castle
as your journey enters its final days why not stroll through the streets of
Cologne and stopped to gaze skyward
at the Filigree Twin Towers of its illustrious cathedral before the tour
comes to a final stop in Amsterdam save time for one last spot of relaxation on
the deck before using your free choice option to soak in a bit of
quintessential Holland at Zaanse Schans with its windmills and open-air conversation
area it's Holland straight from a postcard
